Module Stratego
Package com.stratego

Class Board

java.lang.Object
com.stratego.Board
public class Board
extends java.lang.Object
A model to manage a two-dimensional array of Pieces during setup and play.
Author:
James Ford, Clint Mooney

  • Field Summary

    Fields 
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    private Piece[][] board
    A two-dimensional array to store the current pieces on the board in a 10x10 grid, representing the typical Stratego board.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    Board()
    Creates a Board and defines board as a 10x10 grid.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    private boolean canMoveTo​(int startX, int startY, int newX, int newY)  
    int checkNumberOfPieces​(int playerNo)
    Counts the number of pieces a player has on the board based on their associated turnOrder, which corresponds to the owner field of a Piece.
    Piece getGridLocation​(int x, int y)
    Used to get the piece found at a given grid location.
    int[][] getPossibleMoves​(int x, int y)
    Returns an array of the possible locations a chosen piece can move to.
    void setLocation​(int x, int y, Piece p)
    Used to change the contents of a location on the board.

    Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

  • Field Details

    • board

      private Piece[][] board
      A two-dimensional array to store the current pieces on the board in a 10x10 grid, representing the typical Stratego board.

  • Constructor Details

    • Board

      public Board()
      Creates a Board and defines board as a 10x10 grid.

  • Method Details

    • getGridLocation

      public Piece getGridLocation​(int x, int y)
      Used to get the piece found at a given grid location. The order of x and y is flipped here. If we stick to the traditional orientation of an x and y axis, this is needed to ensure that the board reads the correct space.
      Parameters:
      x - specifies the Piece's location on the x-axis of board.
      y - specifies the Piece's location on the y-axis of board.
      Returns:
      the Piece at location (x, y).

    • setLocation

      public void setLocation​(int x, int y, Piece p)
      Used to change the contents of a location on the board. The order of x and y is flipped here. If we stick to the traditional orientation of an x and y axis, this is needed to ensure that the board reads the correct space.
      Parameters:
      x - specifies the Piece's location on the x-axis of board.
      y - specifies the Piece's location on the y-axis of board.
      p - the Piece to be placed at location (x, y).

    • checkNumberOfPieces

      public int checkNumberOfPieces​(int playerNo)
      Counts the number of pieces a player has on the board based on their associated turnOrder, which corresponds to the owner field of a Piece.
      Parameters:
      playerNo - indicates which player the Piece must belong to in order to be counted.
      Returns:
      the number of Pieces that belong to a given player.

    • getPossibleMoves

      public int[][] getPossibleMoves​(int x, int y)
      Returns an array of the possible locations a chosen piece can move to.
      Parameters:
      x - specifies the location on the x-axis of board that the piece to be considered is stored in.
      y - specifies the location on the y-axis of board that the piece to be considered is stored in.
      Returns:
      an array of the possible locations a chosen piece can move to.

    • canMoveTo

      private boolean canMoveTo​(int startX, int startY, int newX, int newY)
